parse.title: List of structural failures and collapses

text.*:
See also: List of aircraft structural failures, List of bridge failures, List of dam failures, and List of catastrophic collapses of radio masts and towers
Main article: Structural failure
This article may require cleanup to meet Wikipedia's quality standards. The specific problem is: No differentiation between each type of structural failure, extremely hard to navigate. Transportation failures should be placed in their relevant accident lists. Please help improve this article if you can. (February 2018) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)
It has been suggested that portions of this article be split out into articles titled List of bridge failures, Dam failure, List of catastrophic collapses of radio masts and towers and List of aircraft structural failures. (Discuss) (February 2018)

This is a list of structural failures and collapses, including some aircraft, bridges, dams, and radio masts/towers.

This list is incomplete; you can help by expanding it.

Contents

  • 1 Buildings and other fixed man-made structures
    • 1.1 Antiquity – Middle Ages
    • 1.2 17th century – 19th century
    • 1.3 1900s–1950s
    • 1.4 1960s–1970s
    • 1.5 1980s–1990s
    • 1.6 2000–2009
    • 1.7 2010–present
  • 2 Transportation
  • 3 References
  • 4 External links

1979 American Airlines Flight 191, McDonnell Douglas DC-10 O'Hare International Airport in Chicago, Illinois, US 273 dead (all on board, 2 on the ground)
1985 Japan Airlines Flight 123, Boeing 747 Mount Takamagahara in Gunma Prefecture, Japan 520 dead, 4 injured
1986 Space Shuttle Challenger disaster Cape Canaveral, Florida, US 7 dead (all)
1988 Aloha Airlines Flight 243, Boeing 737 Pacific Ocean near Kahului, Hawaii, US 1 dead, 65 injured
1989 United Airlines Flight 811, Boeing 747 Pacific Ocean off Honolulu, Hawaii, US 9 dead, 38 injured
1996 TWA Flight 800, Boeing 747 Atlantic Ocean near East Moriches, New York, US 230 dead (all)
2002 China Airlines Flight 611, Boeing 747 over the Penghu Islands, Taiwan 225 dead (all)
2003 Space Shuttle Columbia disaster over Texas, US 7 dead (all)
2011 Sinking of the Russian ship Bulgaria Kuybyshev Reservoir, Russia 122 dead
2014 Sinking of MV Sewol near Jindo County, South Korea 306 dead
